comments:
I started with a wsdl file in a Web module, went through Top Down Java Bean Web
Service wizard.  I typed in a new Service project and Service EAR project on
page 3 (these 2 projects did not exist in the workspace).  After exiting page
3, only the service (Web) project was created, the EAR project was not created.

Rupam, could you take a look please?
Thanks - CB.

The EAR project seems to be getting created with the correct server target. 
Note that EAR projects are created in the Pre[Service|Client]AssembleCommand's, 
not the Pre[Service|Client]DevelopCommand, so you won't see EAR projects in the 
workspace after Page 3. 

There's still a problem though, because the following NullPointerException is 
occurring when we try to associate the service project with the EAR. I'll dig 
into this further to see if it's us or J2EE.

*** Bug 102962 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=24625)
Apply to org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.creation.ui/plugin.xml

This patch will enable Axis 1.1 Web service support for the Generic WebSphere
6.0.x server. It is not to be committed but it required to enable reproduction
of this bug in WTP.

This is the reason of the problem, wrong component name is passed.


Instead of  componentName  it should be  earComponentName

ComponentHandle earHandle = flexearProj.getComponent
(componentName).getComponentHandle();
Tested with Rupam, need a change in org.eclipse.jst.ws

Created an attachment (id=25163)
apply to org.eclipse.jst.ws

patch 1 of 1
Changed to the right component and owner

The patch is ready to be committed. The fix is pretty obvious from the patch. 
We were creating the EAR component's ComponentHandle with the module 
component's name and then passing that ComponentHandle to data model as the 
EAR's handle (which it was not). I'd like this to be 0.7 because the fix is 
very low risk and fixes the NullPointerException in the assembly portion of the 
Web service wizard framework. This allows automatic association of modules and 
EAR's so that users don't have to manually create the EAR, create the module, 
and associate them before launching the Web service/client wizard.

Chris,

This is the fix I mentioned earlier for consideration in 0.7.

Thanks.

Thanks. Granted we should have committed this earlier, but there is still a 
sliver of time to get this in. Patch reviewed, committed and released, 
v20050721_2110.
